website_summaries.verdict: While it has its limitations, if you're looking for the older model reusable K-Cup by Keurig and it fits your machine, this is the one to get.
pros: The older reusable K-Cup by Keurig that's ideal for most older coffee brewers by the brand
Easy to use, to customize the strength of your cup of joe, and to clean
cons: Does not fit all Keurig coffee makers, including some newer and commercial models
Tends to leave coffee grounds and/or residue in your cup

customer_reviews.title: This is how to keurig! *claps hands*
customer_reviews.text: One thing I notice all the fail pictures have in common is they use finely ground coffee. DO NOT USE FINELY GROUND COFFEE!! (It's in the instructions not too!) I go to whole food, and buy 3.00 worth of coffee (which last a week and I grind on normal grind or bigger). Every week, I buy a new flavor. As a chronic coffee drinker...I'm glad I no longer have to dump pot after pot of delicious coffee in the drain. Just make sure.....YOU DON'T USE FINELY GROUND COFFEE!!! NOOOOO.
customer_reviews.author: SonaTheMaven

customer_reviews.title: Save the environment with Reusable K-Cup Filters!!
customer_reviews.text: K-Cups that you buy from the store (those white, disposable ones) get tossed in landfills and do not biodegrade. I read an article where the inventor of them felt so badly that they are so terrible for the environment and regretted designing them this way. Thankfully there are these reusable K-Cup Coffee Filters. This is all we'll use at home. They are durable (we have one that is going strong after 4 years, being used daily), easy to wash, fit perfectly into a Keurig, and are easy to fill with coffee grinds. I sincerely hope that anyone with a Keurig will consider this product - it is SO simple to use and has a positive impact on the environment!
customer_reviews.author: BachMere

customer_reviews.title: Better than all the other options
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a bunch of different reusable k-cups and they were all horrible. Basically the hot water would go on top of the grounds and then right out the side of the reusable cup. This k-cup set comes with the insert that goes in the coffee machine, so the hot water is forced through and around the grounds. I get a much better cup of coffee. I wanted an all-stainless steel set, but this produces such a better cup of coffee so I'm fine with the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Claydon

customer_reviews.title: Not for people who do not like messes
customer_reviews.text: These Keurig cups are just OK. If your sole goal is to save money by using these cups, then this is fine and the cups are functional. However, if you are successful at filling this up without spilling, if you want an average cup of coffee, you have to fill it to the top and then when you go and remove it, the grains fall everywhere and you keep finding grains for days to come if you do not remove everything and do a thorough wipe-down. It is not worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Marie

customer_reviews.title: (2 year update!) This came in perfect quality and was exactly like the one that came ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly with the Keurig reusable cup. This came in perfect quality and was exactly like the one that came with the original reusable cup. Coffee tastes a lot better again after putting in this new filter! EDIT: I'm on the 3rd Reusable filter. They're great! They last for about 1 year each, until the filter becomes too clogged (coffee dust builds up between the two filter screens) or until one of the filter screen rips from the plastic walls. These help you save money and use less plastic. The best part is being able to use your favorite coffee beans in your Keurig!
customer_reviews.author: A. Zanardi

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment for Roughly 2 Years of Usage
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these about 2 years ago to replace the original, when the mesh started coming away from the frame - I don't remember how long that first one lasted, but I got 2 years out of the replacement before it started to doing the same. I have a sleeping disorder, so coffee is as important as air, so it gets used at least once a day, every day, and for less than $10, I am happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: B Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget when in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: Nothing better than having "backup" coffee when you run out of K-Cups. This allows me to use my "backup" coffee to still have a fresh brewed cup in less than a minute. A little cleanup is required afterward of course but it's better than dragging out my old drip machine from storage. Once you get used to the Keurig it's hard to go back, and this lets you use it regardless of whether you have K-Cups or a backup can of coffee lying around. Note that I don't believe it will work with the 2.0 machines due to the infra-red encoded DRM on the newer K-Cups, but on the original Keurig it works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Easy to use, little hassle.
customer_reviews.text: It's been a little over a year since I've gotten these as a gift. I love, love, love them! I prefer to grind my own coffee and these are a neat alternative to buying those expensive pre-filled coffee cups. Cleaning is easy if you empty and rinse right after use, but if you leave it in the Keurig after using it for a couple hours, takes a little effort to remove the bits of coffee completely. Otherwise, I'd put them in my dishwasher on the weekends. Dries fast. Have used these everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Great by for the older Kurig models!!!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 5 stars on all fronts because the first one I bought last 4 years!!! I love this thing. I can brew any coffee I want and then wash and reuse. The only reason mine wore out is that I was tapping it on my sink to get the grounds out. Now I just use water and my finger to gently remove the grounds. And the fact amazon carried was AWSOME.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth J Payne jr

customer_reviews.title: Great! Much Better Than Throwaway Products
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can buy coffee bulk, save money and save on the environment a little bit! At first I thought it was the wrong product, but it took me a second to realize the whole KCup thing had to be removed... Lol 😆 But it works great and it's made from durable plastic. It's easy to clean, but I haven't put it in a dishwasher. There's not really a need.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: It works in model B40!
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews on many of these products I was very afraid it would not fit or work. A lot of them said they would work on B40 models but the reviews said they did not. When I saw “Old” style in the description, I decided to give it a try. It works!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Great for using your own coffee
customer_reviews.text: I had the original reusable basket that came with my Keurig (this exact same one) for several years, using it once or twice per day, and it eventually started breaking where the mesh met the plastic. I anticipate this new one will last just as long!
customer_reviews.author: S. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Better than othe reusable k-cups!
customer_reviews.text: I love this K-cup! I’ve been using an off brand one from the grocery store and it always comes out dark for a couple seconds, and then it’s just hot water. It was making really weak cups of coffee. I was hesitant to buy this one because of that, but I’m so glad I did!! It comes out dark the entire time the cup is being made! I made the adjustments to my keurig like the other reviews said to do and it was super simple! Will be buying more of these!
customer_reviews.author: Hales

customer_reviews.title: Didnt fit right. Boooooooooooo!
customer_reviews.text: The only was I was able to get it to work in my Keurig machine was to hold the handle down so far with pressure that it feels like I may break it... then it'd brew the coffee. If I let up at all the safety system kicks in and stops the coffee brewing process because the system is no longer closer enough and likely unsafe. I'm guessing this is really made by Keurig or it'd fit. If you filed down the tabs in the back that the normal K-Cup holder clips into, I think it might work. Not sure though.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Best alternative if you use Keurig
customer_reviews.text: This has changed my morning coffee. I am sometimes a coffee snob, but we got a Keurig a few years back because my husband and I work different scheduled and never are able to share a pot, so a single cup approach was best. We also needed something fast. We had started with buying biodegradable options, but also had a funny flavor. Hated the waste from typical K-cups. Now we can have premium coffee fast. Is it the best brewing method for a high end cup of joe? Definitely not, but as a working mom on the go this does the job.
customer_reviews.author: K. Horton

customer_reviews.title: Works great, a little leaky
customer_reviews.text: Well made, easy to use and clean. Nice to be able to use regular coffee and not have to buy and throw away unrecyclable pods. My only complaint is that it leaks a bit on top, just some water. But been using this off and on for over three years and am very happy with it. I tried others offered here and they leak much worse or do not work correctly
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought delicious coffee grounds but didn't have a coffee maker apart from my keurig, so thought this would be a good solution. However, the coffee produced using the product was very weak and had some of the coffee grounds at the bottom. I packed as much coffee as possible into the little cup but it didn't help the flavor and was pretty messy. I ended up just buying a small coffee maker and had much better results. I'll probably just stick to normal k-cups with my keurig. I don't think there's enough room in this small filter for regular coffee and cleaning up the literal hot mess takes away the convenience of a keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria B

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this single cup filter to try to save money on k-cups. I checked reviews to make sure it worked in the Keurig mini...for me, it was a waste of money. The outer grey holder does NOT fit in the mini...so, I used just the black part. Yes, it fits...but there's no cover. I made a cup of coffee, wasn't strong enough at all. Made another cup using more coffee with care...came out with coffee grounds floating all over. Very disappointing. Despite reviews saying it's great, sorry, I disagree and cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great for Fresh Grind
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this filter for over a year now. I take my freshly ground bean of choice, throw it in the filter, and voila! Instant brew. Cleanup has remained easy and the filter has not developed any sour taste or burned sensation. I believe the key to success with this filter is diligent cleanup and maintenance. This fits perfectly in my Keurig and I have not had any negative experiences thus far. Pros: -Simple to use -Easy to clean -Great with freshly ground bean Cons: -N/A Recommend?: Yes. If you own a Keurig and you want a higher quality coffee than that which is offered in typical K-Cup packs, this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Even though it's Keurig brand, it does not work in my Keurig
customer_reviews.text: This was not compatible with my Keurig at work, after reading the instructions & removing the cup that holds the K-cup (confusing, I know) there is a small plastic tab that prevents this cup from seating into the K-cup holder. Additionally, it is impossible to find any sort of information on which "My K-cups" are compatible with which Keurig models - there is nothing on their website & when I called all I got was "press this number, that number", and was unable to ever get a human who could explain anything. I also got no response from Keurig when I e-mailed them.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the same as the original filter and plastic holder that came with my Keurig. My old one had split along the seams and was getting coffee grounds in my drink. So nice to not have that problem anymore. Watch the price on this - I got it for under $4. Prices really fluctuate on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: How Amazon Saved the Day
customer_reviews.text: Somehow I misplaced the Keurig K-Cup and went to my local Walmart to look for a new one. They did not have the correct one and what they had was ridiculously expensive. Amazon had the correct model, at a good price and with free shipping! Within a few days I was able to have fresh brewed coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Happy With Purchase
customer_reviews.text: So happy that I finally purchased this - it's been on my wish list forever. Some of the reviews had me worried, but so far I've had no issues with brewing or having coffee grounds in my coffee. It's easy to set-up and use and lets me feel less like I'm killing the environment. I love that it's reusable and I can use whatever kind of coffee I want!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously bought the "knock-off" (generic) version of this and quickly found that it was a mistake. Coffee grounds got everywhere, including in my cup of coffee. Not so with this genuine Keurig filter! I can now brew my favorite non-K-Cup coffee and enjoy it even more than if it were brewed from my Bunn coffee-maker. For some reason it just seems to have a richer, fuller flavor. It's especially nice since I don't have to brew a half or full pot of coffee when all that I want is a cup. Nice going Keurig, this works great!
customer_reviews.author: Slvrbllt44

customer_reviews.title: Just like a K-Cup but with whatever coffee you like
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a friend, amazon had a great deal on the price. Unfortunately, she had a different model keurig then she thought so they did not fit :( . But, there was an elderly woman who lives in my apartment complex with the proper keurig. I gave it to her & she was so excited. She loves her K-cups but sometimes when her budget is low she has other ground coffee. She tested this filter out & it worked just like a K-cup! She loves the fact that it is reusable and that she can now give away her regular coffee pot because she no longer will need it!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Love it, literally love it. Whether you want to make a single-cup of some freshly ground coffee or if you just want to be "green" or save money - this baby allows you to do all three. My only recommendation would be to make sure you clean it out while the grounds are still wet, otherwise clean-up will take longer than necessary if the grounds have dried to the screen. One other thing to note is that the plastic can retain some flavor if you're using flavored coffee. So if you don't like flavored coffee but your roommate/partner/spouse does - consider buying two of these and using one exclusively for flavored coffee and one for unflavored.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: I works but it is messy and although we buy ...
customer_reviews.text: I works but it is messy and although we buy very high quality coffee and gring it just before brewing, the resulting cup is disssapointing. But if we run out of K-cups it will have to do in a pinch for I canot get out the door without some caffein in order to make it to the coffee shop..
customer_reviews.author: jude

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for me
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to use expensive K cups every time I needed a cup of coffee - this has worked great for us. I have had it 2 years now and no complaints. I did not have to do any monkeying around with my keurig for it to work just fine -- add the coffee, run the keurig, wash out the filter - simple and effective. Read some of the reviews though others have posted about having problems with sealing and water leaking. I for one did not have any issues like that - but I do not know that all keruig machines are created equal.
customer_reviews.author: Strokeofgenuis

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good. Using 2 scoops to fill this for a perfect cup of coffee. Saves me tons of money by using my own ground coffee. Only issue is the sealing. If you pack this too full and don't allow the coffee grounds room to expand you will have water by-pass the coffee and go straight into your cup. boo! The screen mesh is filtering fine enough for me I don't use a paper filter at all. The tiny bit of grounds that do make it past are not an issue for me. (very few and very tiny, like dust)
customer_reviews.author: B. Renken

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: As described, and no issues with use. That being said, I did find it annoying to deal with 2 parts. Now that it's broken (accidentally left in garbage disposal), I'll probably try something different.
customer_reviews.author: bzbee

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Works great, It doesn’t restrict the machine like other off brands. would be better if I didn’t have to remove the adapter that has the needle that punctures the k cups.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to control body of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I used this product in my Keurig K50 coffee maker, and it worked like a charm! I found that yes, you can control the boldness of the coffee by varying the volume of grounds you use within the filter, but perhaps even more important is the *density* of those ground. If you pack the grounds in more firmly, you are going to get darker coffee, and vice versa. Be careful not to pack it too full, however, or you will end up with grounds in your coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Kailah

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for someone that doesn't want to keep buying the paper filters. This not only allows you to use whatever coffee you prefer, but it also is much more wallet-friendly since the amount of coffee beans it takes to fill the cup costs much less than a k-cup. I usually drink pourover or use the French press for my daily coffee, but it's great to have this around for guests or when you need a very quick cup. This is actually my second cup since I lost one in a move... no others do quite the same thing as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Carine Kowalik

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is just what the doctor ordered for avoiding the high price and waste of pre-packaged K cups. Plus, it lets my wife and kids make flavored coffees, which they like and I don't (and I won't let them make in the drip coffee maker, because then the next pot still tastes like the flavored garbage). A full filter is just the right amount of coffee for a 6 oz cup. After use, we dump the grounds into the compost and rinse the filter, and it's ready to go for the next cup. The mesh design does allow some sediment in the coffee, but if that really bothers you, you can buy disposable paper filters for it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rainman

customer_reviews.title: An economical, functional and practical substitution for expansive k-cups.
customer_reviews.text: What a great way to enjoy Keurig coffee maker and a coffee of your preference without having to buy expensive k-pods! Absolutely love it. Easy to install, use, and clean. Just remove the built-in k-cup and replace it with this reusable coffee filter. Use the ground coffee of your choice. I use one tea spoon of coffee with mine, but it will accept as many as 2 - 2.5 teaspoons easy. Watch out though, using as much coffee per cup will probably give you a heart attack. :)
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni T.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for anyone that wants to brew coffee in a Keurig machine that is not available in K-cups or just wants to reduce waste. We purchased this to reduce the amount of k-cups we were throwing into the trash. It is a simple mesh filter that is washable, the filter fits into the hard plastic case and that case replaces the standard K-cup holder in your brewer. It is a bit of pain to clean when you are in rush. If you grind your own coffee, grind it on a more course scale. I noticed finely ground coffee ends up in the bottom of my mug.
customer_reviews.author: Beekeeping

customer_reviews.title: Hit and miss depending on the Keurig machine used.  Still a great money saver if used correctly.
customer_reviews.text: I have two. One that I use in my K60/65 and the seal is not perfect. Makes coffee but sometimes water is pumped too fast and it allows water to flow over the top. In my K10/B31 Mini that I use at work it works perfect. Never leaks and makes a great cup of coffee. I think this is because its pump is not a powerful so it allows the coffee to begin to flow before sending too much to the filter preventing overflow. I can get it to work in the K60 if I put less coffee in the filter basket which also causes a weaker cup of joe.
customer_reviews.author: Blitz Krieg

customer_reviews.title: One thing you should know...
customer_reviews.text: It works as described. I have the Keurig K45 Elite Brewing System and the item fits just fine. So Just in case some of you don't understand, in the picture the grey cylinder replaces the black cylinder you use now to put in your k-cups. So the one thing you should think about is that also means if you are wanting to use regular K-cups as well you would need to swap the grey with the black and so forth. My daughter use's the coco k-cups so she always has to swap out the cylinders.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good filter that gets rid of wasteful plastic K-cups, but does have a couple downsides
customer_reviews.text: Nice filter that's easy to clean and durable. I would give it a 5 star review but there were drawbacks to using the filter. It takes a bit longer to make your coffee with the added steps, but that was to be expected. The other downside to this is it does leave fine grounds in the cups of coffee. This could be because of my grounds are too fine. I'll have to experiment with the crush. Overall, I like it and am glad to be rid of the very wasteful plastic cups!
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected if you follow instructions but not as good as third party versions
customer_reviews.text: There are much cleaner and easier to use third party options out there unfortunately but if you follow the instructions (takes like 5 minutes but it won't work unless you follow them) it will work acceptably... But other brands make way easier to clean and use versions of this, having to unscrew the top and make a mess is unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: EdO

customer_reviews.title: I love the convenience of being able to brew one cup ...
customer_reviews.text: First one I received had a tear in the basket. Return and replacement was handled quickly with no issues. I can't remember when I bought this, but it has been several months now and it has held up well. I love the convenience of being able to brew one cup of coffee quickly and appreciate that I am not generating plastic k-cup trash. Also, love the cost savings!
customer_reviews.author: ImjustAZKen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality... great price!
customer_reviews.text: It's time Keurig owner. Bought the smaller unit on black Friday for $75 to give the brand a try. I heard the off brand reusable cups leak, so I bought the Keurig brand K- cup . Works great & very pleased with the quality of it (stainless steel filter). Would buy this product again! Heard newer Keurig are not going to have the feature to remove their cup holder; hence, eliminating consumers to use their own coffee. If that's the case, I will not upgrade to a larger newer unit. Hope it's a rumor :/
customer_reviews.author: JAZZY04

customer_reviews.title: It leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed with how poorly this filter performed. Despite it being a Keurig brand filter used in a Keurig brand coffee machine, it proceeded to overflow with water, creating a huge mess of water and coffee grounds. Maybe this was their ploy to send you back into the more expensive world of buying K-Cups. I'm not sure where the downfall comes with this. Maybe is that the lid doesn't seal or the lack of a puncture into a foil that creates a seal there... either way, I don't think there is an excuse for this. I bought an Aeropress which is nearly as quick and makes a great cup.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan W.

customer_reviews.title: I needed a new coffee filter for my keurig. ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new coffee filter for my keurig. I used this new one just a handful of times and I was finding a lot of coffee grounds in my cup. I thought maybe I had packed the filter too much but it turns out there was a small hole in the mesh. I don't mind the grounds but it gets tiring after a while of having to floss after my morning coffee.
customer_reviews.author: JCheng

customer_reviews.title: No go for K55
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work properly in the Keurig K55. Seems there's a bit of a gap between the filter holder and the part of the machine that rests on top of it when you close the machine to make your coffee. This results in water leaking inside of that area. Also the water seems to kind of spit out when brewing which to me seems that the water pump is straining to get the water through.
customer_reviews.author: chug

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a few caveats
customer_reviews.text: This device can make very good coffee if you follow the directions and use strong coffee. I used it for the first time today and the first 2 cups were terrible. Weak as can be. I changed it to Peet's French roast and put it on the smallest cup setting. The coffee came out fine and strong. I will try the middle setting and update if that works as well. I have the K45 Elite and had no trouble with water leaking or sediment in the coffee cup. The other thing I will try is a coarser grind as recommended by other reviewers. It is a bit of hassle to clean, but worth the savings.
customer_reviews.author: napa244

customer_reviews.title: quality unit.
customer_reviews.text: After tiring of the clean-up issues of a French-Press coffee maker I was using, I looked to the Keurig unit. Turns out my daughter had been given one as a gift, but has since sharply curtailed her caffeine intake, and gave me hers. While using the pre-packaged K-cups is the ultimate in simple, no-fuss coffee-making, sometimes (being known for my coffee-loving ways), I'll receive a bag of ground coffee as a gift. This little filter is just the ticket to enjoying a fresh, hot cup of quality coffee, and is much easier to clean than the French Press unit. Now, I just need a quality coffee-grinder, because buying the whole-bean coffee provides an even fresher experience.
customer_reviews.author: Rockin' Rick Griffin

customer_reviews.title: it works every time
customer_reviews.text: Save your time/money and buy this "official" reusable cup. Works every time on both brew settings, without errors or special hacking, very easy to clean. I have a very old machine (only two brew options), using Cafe Bustelo espresso style canned ground coffee and using an empty K-cup to measure (I removed the foil, left the filter, let it dry out). I tried other brands and styles, they just didn't work and/or took too much hacking or special measurements.
customer_reviews.author: ruchee patel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. 1. Take out the part that holds the k cup. 2. Fill the metal filter that comes with this purchase with coffee 3. put the metal filter in the plastic holder that the filter came in. 4. close lid (twist) of the plastic holder that has the metal filter in it, full of coffee and place in machine where the original k cup holder was. simple... and economic.
customer_reviews.author: MonicaW

customer_reviews.title: Came without standard packaging, but looks like original Keurig product
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that ordering it from Cuisinparts, it does not come in the full box packaging (see my image in customer images). This is not what is shown in the picture and nowhere does it say that the original box packaging would not be included. However, the part itself does say "Keurig" on it, so it seems that it is still the real McCoy. I love this filter and I trust it more than other products that fit right in the K-cup compartment. It takes only a few extra seconds to unscrew it to clean and refill. I have had one that has lasted me over a year. I got this one just as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: We've encountered bad flow problems
customer_reviews.text: We use Cafe La Llave and Cafe Bustelo, finely ground espresso, in our Keurig. We've encountered bad flow problems, machine stopping mid brew from clogging, or weak coffee because we underfill from fear of clogging. We own the K70 and this attachment might not be as convenient as the other pods with the fancy attached lid and perforated stainless steel basket but it delivers without clogging, good flow, and very dark bold coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Esis

customer_reviews.title: Nice accessory
customer_reviews.text: These work great for about a year then they need to be replaced. Got rid of my Keurig all together so I won't be getting another one. This is a nice option for making your Keurig more cost effective. I have had the knockoff baskets and they don't last as long and are not as sturdy as this one. Definitely worth it on this accessory to go with the name brand.
customer_reviews.author: melissa shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could give it zero stars.....
customer_reviews.text: In an effort to save the environment from all our k-cups & use up some delicious german coffee at the same time, we bought this product. We were expecting a great cup of joe....not to be had with this product. What we got instead was a cup of hot water, the color of weak tea. Others have said that the water filters through too quickly to make a strong cup of coffee. I wish I had listened to them prior to buying this. STILL, not to be outdone, we found..... THIS is how a refillable K-Cup should be done!! I highly recommend the Solofill, but sadly cannot do likewise with the Keurig My K-Cup.....
customer_reviews.author: IrishGirl

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect Description!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Keurig Mini and specifically asked if this filter would be compatible and was told yes. Well, it is NOT and this is a non-returnable item so I am out $6.00! I know that is not a lot of money...except if your only income is Social Security!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for coffee AND tea!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little cup. This was the only reason I gave in an bought a Kuerig. I couldn't stomach spending so much on coffee and tea. This cup makes everything better. It makes a great cup of coffee but even better for tea. I have recently become a tea drinker and loved that the Kuerig made tea but it was so expensive. Now I just buy bagged or loose tea and cut open the bags and dump them into this. Makes great tea!
customer_reviews.author: alaina smith

customer_reviews.title: Great filter for Keurig.
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work every day. It's amazing. No grounds get filter through and clean up is super easy (just rinse it out real quick). It slides right in, push a button, coffee is done is seconds. Take 3 pieces to the sink (it doesn't drip or anything) and rinse it out. The mesh for the filter is of good quality. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: I bought this because I had bought a Mr. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had bought a Mr. Coffee single cup coffee maker that only used the Keurig k-cups and I wanted to make my own coffee as well, but this coffee maker didn't come with any products that let me brew my own.So, I purchased the Keurig my k-cup reusable coffee filter and now I am able to make my own delicious brewed coffee. It fit perfectly inside because the Mr.Coffee machine has the Keurig named etched on the front of it as well, so I knew I could use the original Keurig products for it.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Although I like the K-cups
customer_reviews.text: I received a Keurig machine as a wedding gift in 2013. Although I like the K-cups, some of my guests wanted to have the regular powdered coffee. After 3 years this coffee filter still in great shape! It is very easy to clean. I think this is a must have to Keurig owners. It's great to have the option to use k-cups and regular coffee on my Keurig machine. I highly recommend this coffee filter.
customer_reviews.author: DC_lady2013

customer_reviews.title: Best refillable Keurig filter!
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute BEST reusable filter for Keurig. I've owned 4 other refillable filters that all eventually cracked, punctured or otherwise fall apart. I will order more!
customer_reviews.author: C. Philly

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this so that I could use my own coffee in my Mr.Coffee(Keurig) coffeemaker. In order to use this filter, you must take the filter holder out of the coffeemaker, and insert this one...not just the basket. I bought a cheap plastic basket from WalMart that fits the coffeemaker and works fine. I would not recommend this one....unless you don't mind exchanging the filter basket every time you want to go from K Cups to your own coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Sp226

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Keurig K-Mini
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I was given a K-Mini for Christmas but I'm not a fan of buying the K-cups. This filter sets right in and is easy to rinse out, I use it with loose leaf tea quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: So much more greener, practical and cost effective than buying hordes of K-Cups. Easy to use and clean. Top product!
customer_reviews.author: Ayesha

customer_reviews.title: Reusable K-cup Filter Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This reusable K-cup coffee filter works great. You'll need to experiment with how many teaspoons of coffee grounds to put in for the size of cup/amount of water you want. Two teaspoons of decaf for a large cup works perfect for me. I plan to buy a few more to have ready for when I'm in a hurry or need to make a single cup of coffee for 2 or 3 people.
customer_reviews.author: M. Woolard

customer_reviews.title: Alright enough...
customer_reviews.text: Use for my K15, does a decent enough job, but not as good as real K-Cup. Should use a coarse grind. With a regular, off the shelf grind, I find it real murky at the bottom of the cup, but tastes weak when I add a paper filter...so... Also not mush different from the newer model.
customer_reviews.author: Tani

customer_reviews.title: a must have for the avid coffee drinker, that's poor.
customer_reviews.text: we received our keurig as a gift, and learned quickly that k cups are really expensive, and wasteful. i bought this and didn't use it for a while, until one day we had no more k cups and my boyfriend really wanted some coffee. really easy to use, i tend to put too much, which is a little over half way full of coffee grounds, but that's me, i like it strong. definitely worth it if you don't have the money to waste on k cups all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Keep a dish towel handy.
customer_reviews.text: It's great for saving money, but it does have its issues (discussed in other comments, so no need to rehash). The "fix" with the rubber washer isn't really a fix. We still have problems with it dripping everywhere (though not as much as without the washer). My mother has the same problem when she uses hers, and her grounds are much bigger, plus she uses less of them than my husband does with his. I honestly don't know why Keurig releases a product known to cause problems, but it still saves you a lot of money, even if it does cause messes.
customer_reviews.author: A.VANWIEREN

customer_reviews.title: Inconvenient design with inconsistent results equals unreccommended by myself
customer_reviews.text: Works terribly, don't recommend at all. Easily overspills if too much coffee loaded....just too touchy to get that right with the end result of mucho grains in your cup of joe. Also, inconvenient as it necessitates removal of the basket "receivor" in the mother machine to allow this to fit into. Way too much going on here to be anywhere approaching "convenience".
customer_reviews.author: Paul R DesRoches

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine, but don't use for anything but coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Thought I could use this for tea or hot chocolate but it didn't work. No worries, I mostly just wanted to use up the coffee we had in the freezer using the Keurig K45 machine. It worked like a charm. Might keep using as it makes a good cup of coffee and a bag of coffee is cheaper than the equivalent amount of kcups.
customer_reviews.author: Bryon

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not the best for Yerba Mate
customer_reviews.text: This works ok, there were only a couple tea fragments in my cup. But it's hard to clean, and after a few uses with loose Yerba Mate, the metal filter started to discolor. I don't think it's harmful since this discoloration happens on traditional Mate cups but it looks dingy. Don't forget to take it out immediately and clean it, I forgot mine in the Keurig over the weekend and came back to something awful and had to bleach it.
customer_reviews.author: WFHMomma

customer_reviews.title: Works great and price was reasonable
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. After many years of use the screens on my original filter began to split and tear. I bought one replacement filter from the grocery store, but it didn't fit my machine right. This one is the correct fit for my older machine. Works great and price was reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Keurig Fail: Not compatible with 2.0!
customer_reviews.text: This filter does not fit the Keurig 2.0, which you will not know until you have purchased it and tried to use it. I am especially annoyed by this due to the fact that the only reason I purchased it was because the new machines sensor will not allow me to use my off brand reusable filter, so I was forced to buy the Keurig brand. Now that doesn't work with it either. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Prefer to buy the pods already filled
customer_reviews.text: It was messy, hard to get it to shut once you put it in the maker, and then a mess to clean up. Did not give the "perfect" cup of coffee as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Toni L. Newman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: i waited a good while before posting a review to make sure I had an ample amount of uses from this to properly review. It is great! It lets me use my own coffee that is much much much cheaper than the keurig coffee. The keurig coffee lasted less than a month and cost $12. My current coffe cost $10 and I've been using it for 3 months so far. One full filter with this product will make a nice cup of large keurig size.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it! Easy to use, easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: I love this item! Much cheaper to use your own coffee instead of having to buy the K cups! - Although I will still spoil myself and use a K cup to make myself a fancier coffee every once in a while ;) Thought it was such a great product for my daily, morning cup of coffee, that I bought a second one for my Mom! (Only wish I would have bought them together to save on the shipping!) My friend has a Tassimo and is super jealous that there isn't an item like this for her machine! She hates spending the money on the cups so she has basically stopped using her machine all together!
customer_reviews.author: Rodney T. Dranfield

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly :)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this older model for my Keurig it works well...anyone who says they get coffee grounds in their coffee are probably overfilling the cup.
customer_reviews.author: douglas lima

customer_reviews.title: I love this filter
customer_reviews.text: I love this filter. It works perfectly. It is easy to use and easy to clean. I have not been a big fan of Keurig coffee makers because the end result was weak coffee. Using this filter, I can make the perfect cup of coffee. I am buying a second one to keep at work:)
customer_reviews.author: JenaLaw

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant.
customer_reviews.text: Who thought of this? You deserve some sort of special award. We save so much money on coffee now. My husband is the sole coffee drinker of the house and he really only has one cup every day, so we upgraded our old and tired coffee maker to a Keurig. The K-cups are just outrageous (my not-so-sincere apologies, Keurig). We bought one of these reusable filters and I think it has paid for itself twenty-fold. I can't believe how long a package of coffee lasts these days!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Essentially useless
customer_reviews.text: I have been using K-Caps for years with my Keurig, saving and refilling the little keurig containers with my own coffee, then popping on the plastic cap. This worked, but the coffee was a little week and the machine would periodically get clogged. It seemed like an even better idea to get the keurig reusable filter, but it turned out to be a real disappointment. Even with coarse coffee grounds, the grounds float up and get into the coffee, it clogs the machine and I only get a half cup of coffee. If I hadn't recycled the box right away, I would have returned this. Save your money --there are much better reusable filters out there now.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dieguez

customer_reviews.title: A necessity
customer_reviews.text: We all love our Keurig for one simple reason: convenience. It provides the quick easy solution to our much needed coffee or tea fix without having to make a whole pot. The only downside are the expensive K-Cups and lack of variation for specialty coffee. Enter the reusable filter. If you like specialty coffee ground in a local store, this is the only way you can enjoy it with the convenience of a Keurig. I bought mine and have been enjoying my favorite Hawaiian Grog ever since. Happy drinking!
customer_reviews.author: The Cantos

customer_reviews.title: Inconvenient
customer_reviews.text: What I expected of this item is that I could use it as easily as popping in a k-cup. Unfortunately, you have to take part of the insides of your keurig machine apart to use it and then put that part back if you want to use a k-cup. This seems like a terrible design to me. There are numerous other brands that offer a container that is so much easier. I like the ecobrew type, but there are others I haven't tried that might be just as good. I also see somebody sells a little cap, so that you can just reuse one of the containers from the ready-filled k-cups.
customer_reviews.author: E. Young

customer_reviews.title: If you have a Keurig, you NEED one of these!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase you can make if you own a Keurig and don't want to spend a ton of money on those expensive K-cups! Use whatever coffee you want, without limitations to what's available in K-cups. As an added bonus, you'll be saving the environment from the absurd amount of waste created by K-cups! 😉
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Allen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing for a brand product
customer_reviews.text: The way this reusable cup is structured makes it very difficult to clean. Not only do the coffee grinds get stuck in the little metal mesh, but even under water it is difficult to get rid of everything stuck inside the cup. Kind of disappointing, considering that this is made by Keurig and some of the off-brand reusable cups I've tried deliver better results.
customer_reviews.author: Jhapp

customer_reviews.title: Bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: This works great for making your own coffee or tea... Only thing, I had to purchase another one because when you share one filter with coffee & tea...tea leaves a after taste and smell when you use the filter changing over to coffee. This is after using & cleaning from continue use.... no matter this has a after taste in your coffee. Well I solved that problem... bought one for just coffee, the other can be used for tea... I also put a mark on the one for coffee use only. These are cheap...( so purchase another one).
customer_reviews.author: MinnieWinnie

customer_reviews.title: More trouble than it's worth
customer_reviews.text: This is really more trouble than it's worth. Either use the Kcup coffee or get a regular coffee pot and brew your own. I thought I would save money by buying ground coffee in a bag and still be able to use my Keurig brewer, but the filling, then the dumping and rinsing each time you want a cup, for me it just isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Piwowar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size Kcup
customer_reviews.text: The coffee kcups can be expensive at times - we are using our ground coffee beans more to save money.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl W.

customer_reviews.title: USE YOUR OWN COFFEE - SAVE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: When you want K-Cup like action, but want to be on a Folgers budget...one cup at a time.
customer_reviews.author: EXCLUSIVE SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: If it looks like it won't fit; it won't. List is inaccurate.
customer_reviews.text: Not for all Keurig brewers advertised/listed. Buyer beware. I was curious to how it would fit but it was the genuine Keurig product and the amazon ad lists my brewer model. I don't know which brewers it fits and does not, but it didn't fit either of mine. If it looks like it won't fit; it won't.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works with k55 for those who wants to know :)
customer_reviews.author: .xTina.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed for my Keurig K40 model. Take note that it is for the older models. The price is great too! I believe I always paid more when I bought these at Target or Bed Bath and Beyond.
customer_reviews.author: Heatherrr

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought my Keurig, I had no intensions of buying the expensive single serving k-cups to go in it so I bought this. It works great! My husband drinks the same flavor (everyday) that is his favorite and I get to buy the $0.99 bags of flavored coffee and enjoy variety. I just use one scoop of grounds in this reusable filter. Washing it is easy but the grounds do get all over the sink. We have purchased several boxes of the k-cup singles, and I will admit those are easier. But this makes the Keurig cost effective, which I love.
customer_reviews.author: Nileslady

customer_reviews.title: this reusable filter is an awesome investment for your Keurig if you don't want to ...
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, this reusable filter is an awesome investment for your Keurig if you don't want to pay the ridiculous price for K-cups, or you just want to save the planet from their one-time use aftermath. BUT... if you value your kitchen the way it is, make sure you put the lid back on the filter before you close the Keurig and start the brewing. If you forget this step in your morning process, may the coffee gods look upon you with pity because it will turn your machine into one hell of a mess, guaranteed!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: this makes brown water
customer_reviews.text: i bought this because i hate wasting all the plastic with the disposable k-cups. i figured keurig would be the best manufacturer since it goes in their product. wrong! i tried different grinds, packing the coffee, not packing the coffee, lots of stuff. i even tried using a used plastic disposable cup because i read somewhere that it would help. it didn't help much. i am buying a solofill now to try that since my in-laws like theirs... don't get me wrong. the place that i bought it from on amazon did a good job. it is not their fault the product is awful.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: It works great. You need to be careful to order the ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great. You need to be careful to order the correct one for your machine. If you don't order one of these from Keurig, their newer machine will not work with some Reusable Filters from other companies. Keurig has added a sensor to their machines and their Coffee pods. If they don't match up. Their machine won't work. Keurig is in the business to sell their coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Elizebeth H. Overton

customer_reviews.title: It is not bad
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done. Not as strong coffee than from a real pot but still works. There is a different version of this that I think works much better. You have to almost fill the entire filter to be able to have a good strong cup. Ended up losing the top screw on piece somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: bbo44

customer_reviews.title: mega crap
customer_reviews.text: It's ridiculous they even sell this product. The first time I used it, water went everywhere. The second time, same deal. I called the product hotline and they knew right away how to deal with it ... an annoying repositioning of a rubber component over the needle every time you switch between the k-cup and the "my" k-cup. So finally I manage to brew without getting water all over, but the coffee is insanely weak. Pretty undrinkable after all that effort and much wasted coffee. I read up on how to "fix" this by butchering a used K-cup, and will try that to get it to work. Honestly, it shouldn't be this hard though. I really want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: bgn hunter

customer_reviews.title: Likes that he can buy his favorite coffee and not have to pay an arm and ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet but my son-in-law has. Likes that he can buy his favorite coffee and not have to pay an arm and a leg. K-cups can be so expensive. Be sure to wash out right away though. It took extra work to clean the first time after it had sat from morning until everyone got home at the end of the day and it had dried out. That the only complaint but I don't think that is a problem with the product. Just can't be lazy.
customer_reviews.author: JME

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY USELESS!
customer_reviews.text: This product is nonfunctional as sold and there is much Keurig does not inform the user of! This thing makes a HUGE MESS... hot wet coffee grounds all over. My machine needs to be taken apart to be properly cleaned! Keurig help desk told me I have to reach into the machine - being careful not to cut myself on the cutting blade inside and readjust the O ring EVERY TIME I use this product! I was told another user placed a rubber washer over his filter and fixed it...How about Keurig engineering just making a product that WORKS! I shouldn't have go buy parts right off the bat!
customer_reviews.author: rottwlrmom

customer_reviews.title: Just can't do it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm having the hardest time getting a good, rich, dark cup of coffee with this product. So far, Peets, Seattles Best and Starbucks DARK roasts are the only k-cups that do it for me. Even using those brand coffees, ground fine and packed in, I'm not getting a strong cup from this filter. Maybe user error, but that's my experience. I've followed all the tricks I've read in the comments and reviews for this product. I just can't get a consistently rich cup of coffee with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa G. Highland

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried after reading the reviews and some people having trouble, but I decided to go ahead and buy it because it was so cheap. I followed the directions that came with it and it works perfectly! No troubles at all. Makes me wonder why people had trouble. For me, it was super easy and it didn't have any of the problems other people mentioned. I will certainly save a lot of money using my own coffee.
customer_reviews.author: A. B.

customer_reviews.title: use a tooth brush
customer_reviews.text: some of the reviews complain that it is hard to clean this filter. Use a tooth brush,, so much easier. as for any coffee ground residue it is because generally we use paper filters. Since they don't make them for this it may be an issue. I have a family member that owns one who stated not to grind coffee so fine. I haven't tried this yet my self, but again it doesn't bother me. Enjoy your machine ! shop around, their are different sellers on Amazon each selling for a different price.Target sells for $18.00
customer_reviews.author: Rob

product_meta.title: Keurig My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filter - Old Model
product_meta.description: Keurig 5048 My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filter - Old Model
feature_bullets: Rinse clean under running water after each use
Works in Keurig home brewers, such as K10, B40 Elite, B50 Ultra, and B60 Special Edition, K65, K45
Allows users to use their own gourmet ground coffee in a Keurig brewer
Reusable K-Cup coffee filter exclusive to the Keurig Home Brewing System
Does not fit Keurig 2.0, B100, B100P, or B2000/3, B130 Keurig Office and commercial model brewers

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars7,412 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
